intro: Oubanguia africana, commonly known as the African sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the savannas of sub-Saharan Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to seasonal droughts. Oubanguia africana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
